@galleman he gives good examples why estimates are bad. I believe it is vital to get rid of this tool from the  industrial age.
@galleman by selling your expertise and not a final product. Work in short iterations <= 1 months and give both parties ways to exit early.
@galleman this forces both parties to work together more intense and re-evaluate expectations early/Trust AND commitment are key components

http://t.co/Yye0qJIy8G points you to the revised HTTP/1.1  specification. You should use this information instead of the original RFC2616.
@galleman time estimating creative work (what software projects are) is a stupid thing. You can't know what you haven't done before.
@galleman RFC is a better tool for the wrong task. What the customer expects is not automatically right. #NoEstimates is about that.
